metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25669 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux Kernel where the function sunkbd_reinit having been scheduled by sunkbd_interrupt before sunkbd being freed. Though the dangling pointer is set to NULL in sunkbd_disconnect, there is still an alias in sunkbd_reinit causing Use After Free. Bodong Zhao discovered a use-after-free in the Sun keyboard driver implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-4.4.0-201-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-201-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1121-aws - 4.4.0-1121.135

notes.Note: sbeattie> issue is specific to the sun4/sun5 keyboard driver.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-201.233').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1121.135').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1094.101~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.120~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.106~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-136.140~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1087.96').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
